title: My Top 10 Favorite Cities
name: My Top 10 Favorite Cities
description:
A Map by Bhaley

This is a map of cities I have been to for whatever reason that I have fallen in love with and have made it into my top ten favorite cities list. I recommend to anyone that they visit these cities. Starting with KNOXVILLE, TN of course!!!

properties.description: Posted by BhaleyDid you really think I could list my top 10 favorite cities and NOT name a beach??? Haha, yeah right! DAYTONA BEACH!!! I went to Daytona in 2005 for my Senior Spring Break (SB@DB\'05)!!! I had so much fun there and have countless stories about the entire trip! And the beach is B-E-A-UTIFUL!!!

Posted by BhaleyTHIS IS MY #1 FAVORITE BEACH IN THE UNITED STATES OF ALL TIME! I cannot even count the number of times that I have been to Myrtle Beach! I recommend to a road-tripper to stay in the South Side area; it\'s the party area! AND DEFINITELY GO TO BAREFOOT LANDING AND EAT AT DICK\'S LAST RESORT! And the best hotel is Coral Beach Resort. It\'s amazing (10 pools, bowling alley, arcade, bar, live band/dj, and right on the beach). GO THERE! I am this summer!

Posted by BhaleyWhat can I say? I LOVE TENNESSEE!!! Chatty, as I call it, is just a really fun city! The shopping is great, as well as the people. But it is TN so you can\'t expect any less! I recommend to anyone that they checkout Drumline! It is held every year in Chatty! It is a ton of fun! That\'s what the picture(s) are from!

Posted by BhaleyMy hometown, born and raised. Even the area. Cedar Bluff (the Bluff)!! It\'s a great area and great school! HOME OF THE VOLUNTEERS!!! Doesn\'t get much better than that! (If you are wondering, the picture is just a fun one me and my two best friends took at the World\'s Fair Park)

Posted by BhaleyOf course I have to go for the capital of Tennessee! If you have never been there, I highly recommend it! The center of the city is amazing. And the clubs are soo fun! You have to check out Graham! I always stay in the Antioch area. I feel at home there.

Posted by BhaleyI LOVE LOUISVILLE, KY!!! It is a place I visit often! I have my "KY FAM" up there. It is this group of guys that my sister and I got to know on a cruise about 6 years ago and we have all remained friends since! The city is just so much fun! Only picture I have is of my KY FAM, buy hey, atleast you will get a look at some of the greatest guys ever!

Posted by BhaleyI really don\'t know the name of the area that we were actually in when we went to Cincinnati. I just know it was gorgeous. I believe it was right there on the edge. But it was fun and we just drove around and acted stupid and had a blast!!! (As you can tell in the picture...That\'s me being stupid with some BIG balls we found in Cinci!)

Posted by BhaleyAfter England, I traveled over to Paris and stayed there for a week. I saw every aspect of the city; stayed in Montemarte (2 minutes from the Moulin Rouge). It was absolutely gorgeous! My picture is of me at the gardens of Giverny, a little outside Paris! The one of the elephant is this statue outside one of the MANY art galleries. The last picture is of me getting my picture drawn by a woman in Montmartre (she ripped me off, be careful)!
Posted by BhaleyWhat else can I say other than: LONDON!? It is a HUGE city and every aspect of it is beautiful! I really didn\'t realize that I was not in the United States until I was in London!

Posted by BhaleyI studied at Cambridge University after I graduated from Farragut High School in Knoxville, TN! I absolutely fell IN LOVE with the city. It\'s really a small town, but amazing! A real southern girl would love it there! I plan on living there later in life! My picture is of me and my British friend Chris (the man behind me; a graduate of Cambridge University) punting on the River Cam!
